sentences.en: He cited a sonnet by Shakespeare.
sentences.cn: 他举出了莎士比亚的一首十四行诗.

sentences.en: He read a sonnet that celebrates love.
sentences.cn: 他给读了一首歌颂爱情的十四行诗.

sentences.en: He says he can knock off a sonnet on any occasion.
sentences.cn: 他说他能在任何场合马上写出一首十四行诗.

sentences.en: He says he can knock off sonnet on any occasion.
sentences.cn: 他说他能在任何场合立刻写出一首十四行诗.
他毫不费力地就作了一首十四行诗.

sentences.en: He wrote a sonnet to his beloved.
sentences.cn: 他写了一首十四行诗,献给他心爱的人.

sentences.en: I think it ( will be ) too difficult to write a sonnet.
sentences.cn: 我想写一首十四行诗太难了.

sentences.en: In her trembling voice she read to him Rupert Brook's sonnet.
sentences.cn: 她颤声朗诵给他听卢泊·布鲁克的十四行诗.

sentences.en: In the'sonnet - to Science ', Poe laments the disappearance of magic.
sentences.cn: 在《十四行诗 -- 致科学》里, 坡哀叹魔力之一去不返.

sentences.en: Jack was delivered of a sonnet on the subject.
sentences.cn: 杰克就这个题目作了一首十四行诗.

sentences.en: Our teacher told us to recite this sonnet written by Shakespeare.
sentences.cn: 老师要求我们背诵莎士比亚的这首十四行诗.

sentences.en: Scholars have attributed the sonnet to Shakespeare.
sentences.cn: 学者们认为这首十四行诗是莎士比亚所作.

sentences.en: The composer set a sonnet to music.
sentences.cn: 作曲家为一首十四行诗谱了曲.

sentences.en: The paraphrase of the sonnet is easy to understand.
sentences.cn: 该十四行诗的意译易于理解.

sentences.en: This sonnet has been imputed to Shakespeare.
sentences.cn: 这首十四行诗据说为莎士比亚所作.

trans.tran_en: a poem with 14 lines which  rhyme  with each other in a fixed pattern
